summary: The 2018 National Biodefense Strategy outlines how the U.S. can prepare for and respond to biological threats, such as COVID-19. The pandemic highlighted shortcomings in federal response efforts. For example, federal agencies had problems managing information—like inconsistent federal guidance and lack of transparency about available supplies in the strategic national stockpile. We testified on our decades-long work evaluating federal agencies' biodefense efforts and preparedness, as...
title: Biodefense: Opportunities to Address National Strategy and Programmatic Challenges
